channel.title: Question for RSBuddy users
channel.description: Well since I'm paranoid as actual fuck, I never put my password into RSBuddy, meaning whenever the script stops, it wont log back in, and I have to manually log back in for the script to do anything more after the break. Should I be safe and not have to worry about my password being stolen? Or should I leave my password out of it for good measure?

item.title: Question for RSBuddy users
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:8, topic:413548”]I have always had my password in RSBuddy, and I’ve never been hacked.[/quote]Same. Except I haven’t used it in months (cept to get some object ids and shit for rsps), not sure if that makes a difference.

Read full topic

item.title: Question for RSBuddy users
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Mopar1 Mr Mopar
item.description:
@Mr_Mopar1 wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:6, topic:413548”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=515047.msg3739621#msg3739621 date=1315248669]
Rsbuddy actually realized stealing peoples gold (which could completely turn against them) won’t help them profit. They are going to make money from commission of scripts and advertisements.

[/quote]So are you saying that I should be safe if I put in my password?[/quote]
Yes.

Read full topic

item.title: Question for RSBuddy users
item.dc:creator: @lostmyphat lostmyphat
item.description:
@lostmyphat wrote:

I've been putting my password into RSBuddy for sooooooooooo long and haven't got hacked since Powerbot went corrupt and took people's passwords.
Same. Rsbuddy is great, if you don't feel safe putting your password into the botclient just transfer your GPs to another level 3 or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Question for RSBuddy users
item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

I’ve never EVER put my password in bot clients and it’s paid off. I’ve never been hacked by a bot client.

Read full topic
